body:
Basically the title. It's nice to see more information than just the difference between the number of upvotes and downvotes. It shows if an issue is polarizing and can people react differently to it with seeing if lots of people both agree and disagree. Reddit used to work that way, and it would be a nice feature. 

Also I'm not promoting the downvote button as a disagree button since it shouldn't be used that way, but people do it anyway.
body_html:

Also I'm not promoting the downvote button as a disagree button since it shouldn't be used that way, but people do it anyway.
title: It would be nice to see the total number of upvotes/downvotes a comment/post has

body: Downvotes are supposed to be for people being rude or going off-topic, regardless of opinion. Of course we know from reddit that no one will ever actually use it as such.

body: That's valid reasoning. I don't know what you can do to control the trolls, but it would be nice to have an accurate view of how many people disagree with you. There has to be a solution that ruins the incentive to troll, but also supports free speech. I think the option they have chosen right now works okay.
body_html: That's valid reasoning. I don't know what you can do to control the trolls, but it would be nice to have an accurate view of how many people disagree with you. There has to be a solution that ruins the incentive to troll, but also supports free speech. I think the option they have chosen right now works okay.

post.title: It would be nice to see the total number of upvotes/downvotes a comment/post has

body:
The purpose of the downvote button originally was supposed to mean "this content/comment does not belong here" in the sense e.g. a post about politics in a gardening subreddit does not belong therefore people should downvote it, so it doesn't get seen. 

However with moderation and the ability to make a report that explicitly states "this breaks rule #1" is a more effective way to remove content that doesn't belong, so the downvote button becomes pretty pointless and then becomes a disagree button. 

I know there is a subreddit that is dedicated to the science of different voting systems that I believe had done legitimate research on what would be a better voting system.
body_html:
The purpose of the downvote button originally was supposed to mean "this content/comment does not belong here" in the sense e.g. a post about politics in a gardening subreddit does not belong therefore people should downvote it, so it doesn't get seen.

However with moderation and the ability to make a report that explicitly states "this breaks rule #1" is a more effective way to remove content that doesn't belong, so the downvote button becomes pretty pointless and then becomes a disagree button.

I know there is a subreddit that is dedicated to the science of different voting systems that I believe had done legitimate research on what would be a better voting system.

body: I suppose only allowing the original poster to see the separate counts might work, but I'm not a coder, so I don't know how easy or difficult that is.

parent.body: That's valid reasoning. I don't know what you can do to control the trolls, but it would be nice to have an accurate view of how many people disagree with you. There has to be a solution that ruins the incentive to troll, but also supports free speech. I think the option they have chosen right now works okay.
